intro: Lobelia gibbosa var. simplicicaulis, commonly known as the simple-leaved lobelia, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from blue to purple. The plant typically grows in moist, woodland habitats and prefers partial to full shade. Its leaves are simple, opposite, and often have a slightly hairy texture. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds, facilitating its spread in suitable environments.
